subject: sigh
event:
Life is meaningless and full of pain.

Particularly if you're a Jets fan.

comments.article: But pretty good if you're a Packer fan.  Maybe they can exact some revenge on the Steelers for you.

Agreed. As a Cheesehead transplant in Minnesota, I think it'll be a good game, and the Packers are better at certain positions than the boys from Pittsburgh. But will it be enough?

My condolences, George. I know a couple Bears fans who won't be pleased this morning. :-,

I'm so sorry, sir.

I didn't know who I was rooting "for" going in to this one, as to be honest I don't personally like the Jets or Steelers, but it turns out I wanted the Jets to win after all, judging from my reaction when I learned the result (was watching tennis rather than football today, as is my wont). Sigh.

Go Packers, then.
Yeah.  :(

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article: Maybe what's called for is another one of your what-if stories, this time pitting the Steelers against the Lannister heavy cavalry.
Still better than the Patriots
but they still had a great run.  Making it to the league title season is IMO a pretty solid year.  Hopefully next year they can make it even farther.
comments.subject: It was a tough loss...

comments.article: Chin up, George!  If it weren't for that unfortunate fumble TD late in the 2nd Quarter, the Jets might have pulled it off.  Too bad they came out flat in the first half.  Bum, bum, ba-bum-bum-bum: GO PACK GO!

I'm a Charger fan, and we go through this practically every year, although this year we didn't even make the playoffs.  The worst was the 2006 season where we went 14-2 and lost our first playoff game.  I felt depressed for a month after that one.  But, it gets easier every year for some reason.  Maybe because I expect them not to win so when they do it's a pleasant surprise.
comments.subject: I feel your pain

comments.article: It was the beard, no chance against the beard.
I hope next year all goes better.

Also for those of us who were rooting for the Bears.

The Packers are one of my least favorite teams (only the Cowboys rank decisively below them), but I still have to take them over the Steelers, or more specifically, Ben "the rapist" Roethlisberger.
Go Steelers!   My all time favorite team.  Sorry, had to say that! :)
comments.subject: nfl

comments.article: it happens, it was a run, but yeah, pretty much
comments.subject: loss

comments.article: Not much better if you're a Bears fan...

Pft. You didn't lose to your arch-rivals in a game that they'll rub your noses in for decades.

This will haunt Bears fans for years, where-as for the Jets its pretty much just business as usual.

The first half was a good approximation of what a fight between Tyrion and Gregor would look like. If Tyrion fought without armour, without weapons and blindfolded.

But in the second half the dwarf gave a few good punches in the groin before going down. They bounced back so at least that's something. Though on the other hand it showed that with a few less mistakes in the first half, the outcome could be very different.
But it gives inspiration to take it out on the characters that are at your mercy. There is a twisted kind of justice in that.
What? You want to see everyone die in the next book?

comments.subject: The Boltons and Freys are clearly the Patriots and Steelers respectively.

comments.upictitle: Dance, baby, dance like the world is ending!: Quills
comments.article: Or a Bears fan. :(
Here in 'da Burgh, I was wondering what your take would be.  Please advise on how to not be the Cowboys or the Patriots.  --  Andrew
comments.subject: Jets vs. Steelers

comments.article: Don't win. String together more than two Super Bowl victories in the span of five years, and people are gonna find an excuse to hate you. The Steelers are probably hosed if they win it this year.
comments.subject: Re: Jets vs. Steelers

comments.article:
Life is meaning =) pain is just one perspective.

If you want to not feel pain, then you need to change your perspective!

It could be worse. I have the poor fortune to be a Lions fan. I'm just excited that they won six whole games this season.

(lucky for me, I like hockey better than football...)

Sorry George, I know the feeling.  I feel there is probably no consoling you with comments such as "they played a good game", or "at least it was close".  It's a tough loss no matter how you cut it.  Keep your chin up during the off-season, your Jets (and possibly Giants) have a bright future.

I grew up in Chicago where we are genetically required to hate the Packers, so the loss yesterday was especially painful. I live in Baltimore, where we are environmentally required to hate the Steelers, so the loss yesterday was especially painful. This will be the lamest (and most insulting) Super Bowl ever. Come on Spring Training!

Life is meaningless and full of pain indeed!
comments.subject: Lamest SuperBowl ever!

comments.article: Probably the highest rated SuperBowl ever!
comments.subject: Re: Lamest SuperBowl ever!

comments.article: Bummer on the Jets.....breakin my heart with that steeler shit.
comments.subject: Jets

comments.article: And they kept us believing right up til the end.  Oh well, you can spend Superbowl Sunday yelling "You're in yellow pants!" at the TV.
